name: Garden Island Inn

reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights in a second floor room with a/c. The price was great, the location perfect and the extras provided by the hotel (beach mats/chairs, coolers, snorkelin gear, etc) terrific. We stayed in February, and I would say that you definitely want a/c for maximum comfort. We did not find the tile floors to be exceedingly warm as did a previous reviewer. The room was very large and had a queen bed and two twin beds (we put them together for a double bed). It also had a dining table and chairs, a spacious counter area with sink, coffee pot (and Kona coffee!), microwave and refrigerator. It was definitely large enough for the four of us and would be ideal for parents with two children. The room was slightly dated, but very clean.
reviews.title: Good price, nice extras
Good and Bad - read on and you decide
reviews.text: The location is great for exploring the island. Nearby, there is a shopping center and Kalapaki Beach. There is also a park on the ocean with swings and picnic tables with grills. We ended up cooking dinner in the park a couple of nights which saved a lot of money and tasted terrific!

reviews.title: Friendly, Family owned, Beautiful View
reviews.text: The gear provide by the hotel was fantastic--they even loaned us a flashlight!

reviews.title: Wonderful motel 2 minutes from beach
reviews.text: The staff was friendly, the location perfect and the price affordable. What more can you ask!?!

reviews.title: Garden Island Gem
reviews.text: Based on the amenities, this place deserves an above average rating, but the room experience is such a detraction I thought it fair to give an average rating.

reviews.title: Garden Inn sounds nice, but...
reviews.text: We stayed at the Garden Inn as a "last minute" when we were on Kauai for a wedding, in July, and wanted to extend our time on this beautiful island. The place we were at, Kuhio Shores (no A/C), did not have room when our stay was up (Don't stay there in the summer-you'll be sorry!). The first room at the Garden Inn, downstairs, was pretty awful. Old, worn-out, etc. Just plain BAD. We got an "upgrade" to an upstairs room that was larger, a little nicer looking, and had AC! (It was humid!) But, we found evidence of roaches. So, unless your desparate for AC and want a really low price, $75.00, stay there; otherwise, find something else.

description: The Garden Island Inn is a quaint, affordable boutique hotel by the lovely Kalapaki Beach and Bay, the Kauai Marriott and Lagoons and the Nawiliwili Harbor. Kalapaki Beach offers safe surfing, stand up paddle boarding, canoing, kayaking, sailing for beginners to intermediate, fishing or just plain relaxing and sunning.This is Kauai's center for shopping, live music and dining with a choice of 10 of Kauai's finest restaurants all within a short leisurely walking distance from the Garden Island Inn Hotel.The Garden Island Inn has quick and easy access from the Lihue Airport and to all the sights and activities Kauai has to offer. Let us be your home away from home while you discover Kauai!
